text: In the diagram below, the point P is the anchor point for the rubber band stretcher. To make this drawing, we used one and half rubber bands. This drawing shows a dilation with scale factor 3/2 or 1.5. It transforms triangle ABC into a similar triangle XYZ. The point P is called the center of the dilation.

• What do you notice? What do you wonder?
  • How does the dilation affect the size and shape of the triangle ABC?
  • What relationship do you observe about corresponding side lengths? The corresponding angles?
  • What relationships do you observe between the center of the dilation P, the vertices of the triangle ABC, and the vertices of triangle XYZ?
  • How is this dilation similar to the rubber band stretcher?
  • Try your conjectures on the following two dilations. Are your conjectures still true? Explain.
